Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe with trace of neck; white slip; exterior: neck glazed black; on shoulder, oblique bars representing wing feathers, filled with dots; at left edge, single curving line framing part of wing.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1125 and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1886,0401.1267.d and 1924,1201.36. The fourth sherd in the joined group may be 1924,1201.1157. According to Cook, the decoration seems to have been inspired by the conventional representation of a bird, specifically a partridge: scales for the breast feathers and bars for the folded wings. The breast-feather panel narrowing towards the bottom and the red on these feathers are unusual; the black bands are unusually wide. For a complete oinochoe with this decoration, see Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 4, no. 47 from Rhodes. For parallels, see Louvre A321 from Camiros.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 8, no. 1, pl. 8, no. 1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 247, no. 3a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.147)
